definitions.text: air moving (sometimes with considerable force) from an area of high pressure to an area of low pressure
examples: trees bent under the fierce winds
when there is no wind, row
the radioactivity was being swept upwards by the air current and out into the atmosphere

definitions.text: a tendency or force that influences events
examples: the winds of change
the collision knocked the wind out of him

definitions.text: empty rhetoric or insincere or exaggerated talk
examples: that's a lot of wind
don't give me any of that jazz
he got a tip on the stock market
a good lead for a job

definitions.text: a musical instrument in which the sound is produced by an enclosed column of air that is moved by the breath
a reflex that expels intestinal gas through the anus
the act of winding or twisting
examples: he put the key in the old clock and gave it a good wind

definitions.text: to move or cause to move in a sinuous, spiral, or circular course
examples: the river winds through the hills
the path meanders through the vineyards
sometimes, the gout wanders through the entire body
The road winds around the lake
the path twisted through the forest
roll your hair around your finger
Twine the thread around the spool
She wrapped her arms around the child

definitions.text: catch the scent of; get wind of
examples: The dog nosed out the drugs

definitions.text: coil the spring of (some mechanical device) by turning a stem
examples: wind your watch

definitions.text: raise or haul up with or as if with mechanical help
examples: hoist the bicycle onto the roof of the car
